result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack Paul Bartelt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jack Paul Bartelt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jack Paul Bartelt was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Jack Paul Bartelt was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jail sentence currently serving.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA meeting per week.

supervisions.notes:
All other conditions the same as count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1 and jail sentence concurrently serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jack Paul Bartelt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jack Paul Bartelt in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State  - pleading to Ct 1 and Ct 2. State to moves to dismiss count 3. 2 years probations: conditions, FT emp/schooling, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bar or taverns, costs, AODA and follow through, one AA or similar meeting per week. Burns and Bartelt agree. Bednar has complied with victim witness. Bartelt pleads Guilty to counts 1 & 2. Court goes over PLQ with defendant and finds defendant is freely, voluntairly and intelligently entering his plea, waving his constitutional rights, finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. Burns makes final argument and asks to follow joint recommendation. Bartelt with holds comment. Proceed to sentencing. Court - Count 1, with hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions: costs, FT emp/schooling, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, AODA and follow through with recommendations, must attend one AA/NA or similar meeting per week. Count 2 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - same condtions as count 1. Probation is to be concurrent to current sentence defendant is currently serving. DNA with verbage, Burns will file objection to DNA, right to appeal.

Defendant Jack Paul Bartelt, in custody, in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:28 AM. State - will be recieiving waiver of PH and has filed an INFO which mirrors complaint. Burns and Bartelt agree on waiving PH. Court goes over questionairre with Bartelt. Court finds the defendant has freely and voluntarily waived PH. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Burns has copy of INFO and waives further reading, Bartelt understands charges, Burns enters NG plea on all counts. Bond continued. Final pre-trial scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jack Paul Bartelt in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:06 PM. State - matters are not resolved together at this point, here for INIT on 15CF196 and FPT on 15CF127. Burns and Bartelt provided with complaint in Court for 15CF196. Court reads charges and penalties. Burns and Bartelt understand charges and penalties. Burns waives further reading, requests PH, will waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, sets for PH and believes it will be waived, on 1/11/16 at 9:15 AM.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:15 am.
No contact with Schaefer's Food Mart or Glenda Parks-Blair.

Bartelt appears via video from FC jail with Attorney Burns appearing in court. Charles Simono appears for State. Burns requested hearing for bond review, there is an agreement in other case and asks for signature bond. State - does not object but asks for a no contact with Glenda Park-Blair and Schaefer's Grocery Store. Court imposes $1000 signature bond, no contact with Glenda Parks/Blair or Schaefer's Grocery Store.
No contact with Schaefer's Food Mart.
